posts.title: Database Design Best Practices
posts.content: Good database design is crucial for application performance and maintainability. This post covers normalization, indexing strategies, relationship modeling, and common pitfalls to avoid. Whether you're working with SQL or NoSQL databases, these principles will help you create better data structures.
posts.author: Gibson

posts.title: How I Broke Then Built a Blog App From Scratch — A Developer's Confession
posts.content:
When I first started coding, JavaScript felt like a mischievous genie—powerful but full of tricks. One moment I’m declaring let, the next I’m debugging an undefined variable inside a forEach. Nothing made sense… until it slowly did.

Last week, I built a simple blog post manager. At first, I thought adding a post with text was enough. But then I wanted images. Then edit functionality. Then full CRUD. Each time, I thought I’d “finished,” I realized the app wasn’t truly usable.

Here’s what I learned:

innerHTML isn’t magic—but it lets you structure content dynamically and beautifully.

Editing images? Not just URLs! I learned to read FileReader outputs and store base64 strings.

Breaking Git is part of learning. I had to pull --allow-unrelated-histories more times than I want to admit.

Comments matter. My future self thanks me every time I return to the code and see // dynamically create post detail view.

I now understand one thing: coding isn’t about finishing—it’s about improving. Just like life.

Gibson out.
posts.author: Gibson
